page.title: 05Worksop College Buildings
page.content: Just before 1890, the Duke of Newcastle studied at Ellsmere College and finally at Denstone College. Both of these colleges were run by the Woodard Corporation and the Duke was so impressed with the two that he had been to,that he decided to give them 90 acres to build another one just to the South of Worksop.He built the drive to the college grounds and lined it with cedar trees whilst Aston Webb constructed the college buildings. The construction of the college began in 1890 and it was opened in 1893. Many smaller buildings have been built since including buildings for the staff,a Music and Arts school, Boarding house,swimming pool and another gymnasium. This was built in order to replace the original gymnasium which was destroyed by fire in 1942.
